metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000246 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.description: Python package pysaml2 version 4.4.0 and earlier reuses the initialization vector across encryptions in the IDP server, resulting in weak encryption of data.

notes.note: tyhicks> The discussion in the GitHub issue explains why this isn't currently an issue but could be in the future if new cipher modes are used.

criterions.comment: python-pysaml2 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu2').
